title.narrative: ACCESS TO SERVICES ADAPTED FOR ADOLESCENT

description.narrative: Disaggregated data and analytical evidence on monetary and multidimensional child poverty, and information on public social sector spending are available to inform advocacy and programming.

participating-org.narrative: CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATION: Community based organization

sector.narrative: Adolescent participation data/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)
HIV testing including self testing and counselling in adolescents
Provision of skills development for multiple age groups (including in temporary learning spaces)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Adolescent Empowerment & Community Resilience)
Burundi Country Programme Document 2010-2014 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Disaggregated data and analytical evidence on monetary and multidimensional child poverty, and information on public social sector spending are available to inform advocacy and programming.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the development of menstrual hygiene management (MHM) materials that were used by school management committees (comprised of parents, teachers and adolescents) in 123 schools with positive impact on girls' retention. 3,340 adolescents 15-19 were tested for HIV for the first time and received the test results. Furthermore, 3900 community agents were equipped with training and communication materials and 240,000 adolescents girls and boys regularly participated in awareness sessions on nutrition equipped with knowledge and skills to sensitize their peers at community and family levels. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of people with their skills enhanced in the areas of social and behavior change through UNICEF support
Existence of a multi-sectoral, adolescent policy/action plan (reflecting sectoral commitments for adolescents)
Number of adolescents having their knowledge strengthened on essential family practices (nutrition, menstruation management, WASH, protection, etc.)
Availability of a communication strategy for behavior change for adolescent girls and boys and young people including those of key populations
Availability of communication strategies for behavior change
